title: Pep Guardiola provides Kevin De Bruyne fitness update ahead of Manchester City vs Wolves
text:
Kevin De Bruyne picked up a groin injury during Man City’s win over Everton last weekend (Picture: Getty)

Pep Guardiola insists Kevin De Bruyne’s groin injury is not a ‘big, big problem’ despite the influential Manchester City midfielder having been omitted from the Belgium national team squad ahead of their Euro 2020 qualifiers.

De Bruyne endured an injury ravaged season last term, but has begun the current campaign in spellbinding form, scoring twice and registering eight assists already.

The 28-year-old missed City’s midweek win over Dinamo Zagreb and will not be fit enough to face struggling Wolves on Sunday.

‘Sometimes he doesn’t play,’ said Guardiola during his pre-match press conference. ‘He is not fit.

‘There was one game at Norwich. Sometimes he is a substitute but when he feels good he is good. After the international break he will be ready. It’s not a big, big problem.’

Sunday’s opponents caused City problems last season, particularly at Molineux, but have struggled to cope with the rigours of balancing Premier League and European commitments so far this term.

Nuno Espirito Santo’s side have won just once in the league this season but record a morale boosting win at Besiktas in the Europa League last night and Guardiola knows City are in for a stiff examination.

‘Yesterday they took an incredible result,’ he added. ‘I saw the game and they were so solid as expected.

Willy Boly scored Wovles’ winning goal against Besiktas in the Europa League (Picture: Getty)

‘At the end, they have a team to make you suffer in the Premier League.

‘They know exactly what they have to do, three or four seasons together and there is a really impressive defensive structure. We have to be smart to take a result.’
